task.title: Task: Functions for a linear trend line
task.shortdesc: How to use the functions SLOPE en INTERCEPT for a linear trend line.

context.p: The slope of the trendline and the interception with the y-axis can be determined with the functions SLOPE and INTERCEPT.

step.cmd: Select an empty cell on the worksheet and call the wizard Insert function.
Select in category Statistical the function SLOPE. Click OK.

stepresult.p: The dialog box Function Arguments is displayed.

step.cmd: Specify for Known_ys range B2:B11 and for Known_xs range A2:A11. Click then OK
step.stepresult: The cell displays the value of the slope: 2,95503212

step.cmd: Determine the same way in another cell the value of INTERCEPT.
step.stepresult: The value of the intercept is: 41,99036403

taskbody.result: From the values for SLOPE and INTERCEPT you can determine the equation of the trend line:Productiontime = 2,95503212*Weight + 41,99036403
